thread.title: Lady Gaga's music sales rocket after Super Bowl show
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga's music sales rocket after Super Bowl show | Daily Mail Online

author: Associated Press
title: Lady Gaga's music sales rocket after Super Bowl show
text:
Lady Gaga may be the real winner of Super Bowl 51 after sales for her songs skyrocketed more than 1,000 per cent.
The singer, whose stunning halftime show was instantly hailed as one of the 'best ever', sold about 150,000 digital albums and songs in the US on Sunday alone.
The figures marked a 1,000per cent increase compared to sales the day before, according to Nielsen Music.
Lady Gaga saw sales for her songs skyrocket more than 1,000 per cent after she gave a stunning halftime show performance at Super Bowl 51
On iTunes, Lady Gaga's songs made up half of the top 10 most popular songs, showing that her hit singles from 2008 still had staying power
Lady Gaga's best-selling song on Sunday was Million Reasons with 45,000 downloads — nearly a 900per cent increase compared to the 5,000 purchases made the day before, according to Nielsen Music.
In total, her albums were downloaded more than 23,000 times and her songs racked up more than 125,000 purchases.
She performed several of her earlier hits and sales of Born This Way, Bad Romance and Poker Face all spiked in the aftermath of her show.
On iTunes, Lady Gaga dominated half of the top 10 most popular songs, showing that her hit singles from as old as 2008 still had staying power.
Riding on the wave of her impressive 13-minute performance, Lady Gaga announced late Sunday night her plans for a 48-date world tour kicking off this summer.
Lady Gaga's best-selling song on Sunday was Million Reasons, with 45,000 downloads — up nearly 900 percent compared with the previous day
Riding on the wave of her impressive 13-minute performance, Lady Gaga announced her plans for a 48-date world tour kicking off this summer late Sunday night
The performance attracted 117.5million viewers, making it the second-biggest audience for the halftime show after Katy Perry drew 118.5million viewers in 2015, Billboard.com reported.
Lady Gaga's performance was extraordinary from the outset, as a pre-recorded tape showed her belting out a medley from the stadium roof in front of an army of 300 drones forming a twinkling American flag in the sky.
The singer, clad in a sparkling silver bodysuit and knee high boots, then appeared to leap from the edge and descended onto the stage with the help of some sturdy wires.
In the run-up to the event, many assumed Lady Gaga would make an overt political statement given her critical remarks about President Donald Trump in the past.
But she emphasized unity instead, delivering a subversive message against the president's policies which was largely looked over.
Several songs and costume changes later, fans and fellow celebrities alike applauded Lady Gaga for pulling off the solo 13-minute performance with panache.
Lady Gaga's performance also drew praise from public figures on both sides of the political spectrum
The pop star, who has spoken out against Trump, delivered a subtle message of unity instead
